articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — An Israeli airstrike on a compound housing journalists in southeast Lebanon has killed three media staffers, Lebanon’s state-run National News Agency said Friday.
articles.title: An Israeli airstrike on a journalist compound kills 3 TV staffers, Lebanon state news says

articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — An Israeli airstrike on a compound housing journalists in southeast Lebanon has killed three media staffers, Lebanon’s state-run National News Agency said Friday.
articles.title: An Israeli airstrike on a journalist compound kills 3 TV staffers, Lebanon state news says

articles.author: COLLEEN LONG, DARLENE SUPERVILLE and NADIA LATHAN
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris will team up with Beyoncé on Friday for a rally in solidly Republican Texas aimed at highlighting the perilous medical fallout from the state's strict abortion ban and putting the blame squarely on Donald Trump.
articles.title: Harris, Beyoncé team up for a Texas rally on abortion rights — hoping battleground states hear them

articles.author: DAN MERICA
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump said Thursday that China's leader would handle Vice President Kamala Harris “like a baby” if she's elected to the White House, as the former president and his top allies increasingly have moved to infantilize the Democratic nominee.
articles.title: Trump says China's leader will bully Harris 'like a baby' as his allies try to infantilize her

articles.author: CHARLOTTE GRAHAM-McLAY
articles.description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand (AP) — King Charles III told a summit of Commonwealth countries in Samoa on Friday that the past could not be changed as he indirectly acknowledged calls from some of Britain’s former colonies for a reckoning over its role in the trans-Atlantic slave trade.
articles.title: King Charles tells summit the past can't be changed as leaders ask Britain to reckon with slavery

articles.author: CLAIRE GALOFARO and KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: HENDERSON, Nev. (AP) — The 50-year-old newspaper was turning yellow and its edges fraying, so she had it laminated, not as a memento but as proof — America made a promise to her, and did not keep it.
articles.title: ‘US doesn’t see me as an American’: Thousands of adoptees live in limbo without citizenship

articles.author: JONEL ALECCIA and DEE-ANN DURBIN
articles.description: A California-based produce company was the source of fresh onions linked to a deadly E. coli food poisoning outbreak at McDonald’s, officials with the restaurant chain said Thursday.
articles.title: McDonald's says onions from California-based produce company linked to deadly E. coli outbreak

articles.author: STEFANIE DAZIO, JAIMIE DING and CHRISTOPHER WEBER
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Prosecutors recommended Thursday Erik and Lyle Menendez be resentenced for the 1989 killings of their parents in the family’s Beverly Hills home, providing the brothers with a chance at freedom after 34 years behind bars.
articles.title: Prosecutors seek resentencing for Erik and Lyle Menendez in 1989 killings of their parents

articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Progressive Democrats warn Kamala Harris risks losing the support of a small but significant portion of her political base unless she changes her campaign's closing message — and its messengers — immediately.
articles.title: Progressives warn Harris must change her closing message as the election looms

articles.author: R.J. RICO
articles.description: If Donald Trump wins the presidential election, Republicans hope he will fulfill a longstanding GOP goal of privatizing the mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, which have been under government control since the Great Recession.
articles.title: Allies hope a Trump win changes the system for mortgages. Some warn it will make them pricier
